content:
Diagnosis:	T4aN2cM1 p16 negative squamous cell carcinoma of larynx with pulmonary metastases

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Total laryngectomy and bilateral neck dissection
		1 Feb - 15 Mar 2024 Post-operative chemoradiotherapy with weekly cisplatin
		20 Apr 2024 Started pembrolizumab monotherapy

Histology:	Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, extensive extranodal extension, margins clear

Current Situation:	Seen following cycle 3 pembrolizumab

[redacted name] attended clinic today for review. Recent CT chest shows stable pulmonary metastases with no new sites of disease. However, he has developed grade 3 pneumonitis requiring admission last week and treatment with high-dose steroids. His breathlessness has improved with prednisolone 60mg daily but he remains PS 2. After discussion with the patient and review of the CT findings, we have decided to permanently discontinue pembrolizumab. Once the pneumonitis has fully resolved, we will commence second-line chemotherapy with carboplatin and paclitaxel. I have arranged review in 2 weeks with repeat chest x-ray to confirm resolution of the pneumonitis before starting chemotherapy.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, extensive extranodal extension, margins clear

cancer_timeline.value: Total laryngectomy and bilateral neck dissection
Permanently discontinuing pembrolizumab due to grade 3 pneumonitis
CT chest shows stable pulmonary metastases with no new sites of disease

status_updates.value: Stage IVA laryngeal cancer with lung metastases. Developed severe pneumonitis on pembrolizumab requiring treatment discontinuation
Grade 3 pneumonitis requiring hospital admission and high-dose steroids
Permanently discontinuing pembrolizumab, plan to switch to carboplatin and paclitaxel once pneumonitis resolved
Repeat chest x-ray in 2 weeks to confirm resolution of pneumonitis
Review in 2 weeks before starting chemotherapy
